civilopediaText.text: Food Consumption and Unit Upkeep
Understanding how units consume food and require upkeep is crucial for effective city and military management.
Unit Food Consumption
Most military units require food from your cities' population to maintain their strength and effectiveness. When you train military units, they effectively 'eat' from your city's food production.
Key mechanics:
• Each military unit typically consumes 1 food per turn from your cities
• Garrisons (units stationed in cities) may consume less food or none at all
• Civilian units like Workers and Settlers usually don't consume food
Gold Upkeep
Military units also require gold for maintenance, representing equipment upkeep, training, and supplies.
• More advanced units typically require higher upkeep costs
• Units in enemy territory may require additional upkeep
• Insufficient gold can result in unit disbandment
Army Management and Garrisons
Effective army management involves balancing active field forces with defensive garrisons in your cities.
City Garrisons
Garrisoning units in your cities provides several important benefits:
• Defensive bonuses against enemy attacks on the city
• Reduced unit upkeep costs (food and gold)
• Faster healing and recovery for wounded units
• Protection of city improvements and population
Army Organization
Managing multiple units effectively requires understanding of unit stacking and movement:
• Some units can stack together in the same tile
• Different unit types complement each other in combat
• Coordinate movements to maximize tactical advantages
Heroes and Leadership
Heroes are unique, powerful units that provide significant bonuses to your civilization and military forces.
Hero Units
Heroes are distinguished from regular units by their exceptional abilities and leadership qualities:
• Significantly higher combat strength than regular units
• Special abilities that can affect nearby allied units
• Often irreplaceable - losing a hero is a major setback
• May provide civilization-wide bonuses
Leadership Bonuses
Heroes can provide various bonuses to your civilization:
• Combat bonuses to nearby units
• Experience bonuses for training new units
• Cultural or scientific advancement bonuses
• Special diplomatic or exploration abilities
